sailpoint.object

Class PasswordPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.PasswordPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class PasswordPolicy
extends SailPointObject
    When a password is set/changed this is the password policy that defines the requirements for a valid password. Used by PasswordPolice object to determine password validity. Stored in Application object.
    See Also:
    PasswordPolice, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        This method traverses all members of a SailPointObject so that they are loaded and available to a session even after they have been detached. The default implementation does nothing. Subclasses must implement this functionality themselves if they need to provide it.
        Overrides:
        load in class SailPointObject

      • convertConstraints

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertConstraints()
        Transform the constraints into a user readable string localized to the server. If policy has no constraints returns a list containing the no constraints message
        Returns:
        A user readable string of the constraints localized to the server.

      • convertConstraints

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertConstraints(java.util.Locale locale,
                                                  java.util.TimeZone timeZone)
        Transform the constraints into a localized user readable string. If policy has no constraints returns a list containing the no constraints message
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale to localize to
        timeZone - the timezone to localize to
        Returns:
        List of localized constraints

      • convertConstraints

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertConstraints(java.util.Locale locale,
                                                  java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                                  boolean addNoConstraintsMessage)
        Transform the constraints into a localized user readable string.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale to localize to
        timeZone - the timezone to localize to
        addNoConstraintsMessage - if true if there are no constraints a list with the no constraints message is returned
        Returns:
        List of localized constraints

      • hasAssignedScope

        public boolean hasAssignedScope()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        A few SailPointObjects do not have assigned scopes. They should override this to return false if they do not.
        Overrides:
        hasAssignedScope in class SailPointObject

      • hasName

        public boolean hasName()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        Return true if the object has a name. This is used by the AbstractSailPointObject and the PersistenceManagers to tell if the name can be used in a search filter.

        It is almost always true, but a few classes like log records do not have meaningful names. Consider using ObjectUtil.hasName(SailPointContext, Class) instead

        Overrides:
        hasName in class SailPointObject

      • getUniqueKeyProperties

        public java.lang.String[] getUniqueKeyProperties()
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        Return a list of property names other than "id" that combined make up a unique identifier for this object. If the value is null, and isNameUnique is true it is assumed that "name" is the unique key.

        This is overloaded in a few subclasses where name alone is not a unique key. One example is ManagedAttribute which are identified by the combination of _application, _attribute, and _value properties.

        This is only used when importing files of XML that do not contain unique database ids. To prevent duplicates, first objects must be matched by name or unique key combination before new objects are created.

        Overrides:
        getUniqueKeyProperties in class SailPointObject

      • assimilatePolicies

        public void assimilatePolicies(java.util.List<PasswordPolicy> passwordPolicies)
                        throws GeneralException
        Merges the constraints of the passed PasswordPolicys into this policy with the most strict set of constraints
        Parameters:
        passwordPolicies - List of policies to be merged
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If merging policies would create an invalid policy
